item.title: Comcast Goes Mobile With Cellphone Service For Existing Customers
item.description: April 6, 2017 - Comcast's new cellphone offer will use Verizon's wireless network and Comcast's own Wi-Fi hotspots. Xfinity Mobile offers prices that are generally cheaper than major wireless carriers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 6, 2017 - Comcast's new cellphone offer will use Verizon's wireless network and Comcast's own Wi-Fi hotspots. Xfinity Mobile offers prices that are generally cheaper than major wireless carriers. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/06/522851370/comcast-goes-mobile-with-cellphone-service-for-existing-customers

item.title: Amazon To Refund Millions In Unauthorized In-App Purchases
item.description: April 6, 2017 - The Federal Trade Commission sued Amazon and other companies after children racked up millions of dollars of in-app purchases without their parents' knowledge. The FTC and Amazon have dropped appeals.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 6, 2017 - The Federal Trade Commission sued Amazon and other companies after children racked up millions of dollars of in-app purchases without their parents' knowledge. The FTC and Amazon have dropped appeals. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/06/522826507/amazon-to-refund-millions-in-unauthorized-in-app-purchases

item.title: What Should We Make Of The 'Tweetstorm' or 'Thread,' Or Whatever You Call It?
item.description: April 5, 2017 - They're all over Twitter: Strings of tweets about politics or Russian plots or long thoughts. Maybe they're a new way to tell stories, but they say just as much about us as they do about the platform.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 5, 2017 - They're all over Twitter: Strings of tweets about politics or Russian plots or long thoughts. Maybe they're a new way to tell stories, but they say just as much about us as they do about the platform. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/05/521835755/what-should-we-make-of-the-tweetstorm-or-thread-or-whatever-you-call-it

item.title: How Driverless Vehicles Could Harm Professional Drivers Of Color
item.description: April 5, 2017 - African-American professional drivers earn a median annual wage nearly $2,500 higher than in nondriving jobs. For Hispanic drivers it's a $5,800 premium, and Native American drivers earn $2,000 more.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 5, 2017 - African-American professional drivers earn a median annual wage nearly $2,500 higher than in nondriving jobs. For Hispanic drivers it's a $5,800 premium, and Native American drivers earn $2,000 more. http://www.npr.org/sections/codeswitch/2017/04/05/522597987/how-driverless-vehicles-could-harm-professional-drivers-of-color

item.title: Once An Alternative To Mainstream TV, YouTube Now Offers Just That With New Service
item.description: April 5, 2017 - With its streaming TV service launching Wednesday, YouTube joins a crowded field. But it offers several features the others don't.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 5, 2017 - With its streaming TV service launching Wednesday, YouTube joins a crowded field. But it offers several features the others don't. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/05/522739004/once-an-alternative-to-mainstream-tv-youtube-now-offers-just-that-with-new-servi

item.title: State And Local Officials Wary Of Federal Government's Election Security Efforts
item.description: April 5, 2017 - The federal government's new focus on election security has state and local officials concerned that they'll be told how to run their elections in the name of security.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 5, 2017 - The federal government's new focus on election security has state and local officials concerned that they'll be told how to run their elections in the name of security. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/05/522732036/state-and-local-officials-wary-of-federal-governments-election-security-efforts

item.title: Yahoo And AOL Move In Together Under 'Oath,' Verizon's New Digital Arm
item.description: April 5, 2017 - The digital content mashup of Internet oldsters will be led by Tim Armstrong, AOL's CEO. Though the Yahoo deal was widely panned, it gives Verizon a vast subscriber base appealing to advertisers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 5, 2017 - The digital content mashup of Internet oldsters will be led by Tim Armstrong, AOL's CEO. Though the Yahoo deal was widely panned, it gives Verizon a vast subscriber base appealing to advertisers. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/05/522671331/yahoo-and-aol-move-in-together-under-oath-verizons-new-digital-arm

item.title: Should Viewers Of Facebook Live Gang Rape Face Charges?
item.description: April 4, 2017 - Authorities say that about 40 people may have watched the rapes of a 15-year-old girl that were streamed on the social media platform — and that none of them reported the crimes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 4, 2017 - Authorities say that about 40 people may have watched the rapes of a 15-year-old girl that were streamed on the social media platform — and that none of them reported the crimes. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/04/522574666/should-viewers-of-facebook-live-gang-rape-face-charges

item.title: The Father Of The Web Is Worried About How Ugly It's Become
item.description: April 4, 2017 - When he invented the Web 28 years ago, Tim Berners-Lee saw it as a way to break apart silos and connect the world. Now he's increasingly troubled about its dark side, but he believes it can be fixed.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 4, 2017 - When he invented the Web 28 years ago, Tim Berners-Lee saw it as a way to break apart silos and connect the world. Now he's increasingly troubled about its dark side, but he believes it can be fixed. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/04/522593360/the-father-of-the-web-is-worried-about-how-ugly-its-become

item.title: How Two Georgia Tech Students Came Up With The Common App For Internships
item.description: April 4, 2017 - Students create their profile and can apply for several internships with one click. Currently, InternBlitz is available to students at Georgia Tech, but there are plans to add more campuses soon.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 4, 2017 - Students create their profile and can apply for several internships with one click. Currently, InternBlitz is available to students at Georgia Tech, but there are plans to add more campuses soon. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/04/522038496/how-two-georgia-tech-students-came-up-with-the-common-app-for-internships

item.title: How Russian Twitter Bots Pumped Out Fake News During The 2016 Election
item.description: April 3, 2017 - Clint Watts, a former FBI agent, describes a diffuse network of Russian hackers and propagandists conducting a misinformation campaign that didn't stop with the election of President Trump.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 3, 2017 - Clint Watts, a former FBI agent, describes a diffuse network of Russian hackers and propagandists conducting a misinformation campaign that didn't stop with the election of President Trump. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/03/522503844/how-russian-twitter-bots-pumped-out-fake-news-during-the-2016-election

item.title: Pittsburgh Offers Driving Lessons For Uber's Autonomous Cars
item.description: April 3, 2017 - Uber has been testing driverless cars in the city for the past six months. Local officials are happy for the investment the experiment brings and for the boost to the city's reputation as a tech hub.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 3, 2017 - Uber has been testing driverless cars in the city for the past six months. Local officials are happy for the investment the experiment brings and for the boost to the city's reputation as a tech hub. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/03/522099560/pittsburgh-offers-driving-lessons-for-ubers-autonomous-cars

item.title: Self-Driving Cars Raise Questions About Who Carries Insurance
item.description: April 3, 2017 - Currently, insurance rates are calculated based on drivers' claims histories and driving records. Driverless cars are expected to shift the liability toward carmakers. But it won't happen all at once.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 3, 2017 - Currently, insurance rates are calculated based on drivers' claims histories and driving records. Driverless cars are expected to shift the liability toward carmakers. But it won't happen all at once. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/03/522222975/self-driving-cars-raise-questions-about-who-carries-insurance

item.title: Solar Power Advocates Undeterred By Trump's Climate Policies
item.description: April 2, 2017 - Some worry that President Trump's rollback in climate policy will hurt renewable energy. But in Arizona, a state that has embraced solar energy, those in the industry say the outlook is still bright.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 2, 2017 - Some worry that President Trump's rollback in climate policy will hurt renewable energy. But in Arizona, a state that has embraced solar energy, those in the industry say the outlook is still bright. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/02/522357476/solar-power-advocates-undeterred-by-trumps-climate-policies

item.title: Actors Give Voice To Trump's Tweets
item.description: April 2, 2017 - As long as there have been national leaders, there have been court jesters. Whether skewering the boss on stage, on TV or now, on Twitter, it's a tradition satirists take seriously.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 2, 2017 - As long as there have been national leaders, there have been court jesters. Whether skewering the boss on stage, on TV or now, on Twitter, it's a tradition satirists take seriously. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/02/522357462/actors-give-voice-to-trumps-tweets
